t: If You're Still Boiling Water on the Stovetop, You're Doing It Wrong — Upgrade to the Electric Kettles That Aced Our Tests
s: In most electric kettles, the actual boiling chamber is made of either glass or stainless steel. The choice between the two comes down to personal preference, mainly in terms of whether you want to see the water boiling as well as how much water is in the kettle. Stainless steel is much more durable than glass, but the trade-off is the hassle of opening the lid and letting the steam escape every time you want to check the water level. Some brands ...
